attributes.action: Keep the homeless sheltered. We say “No” to removing the financial assistance
attributes.additional_details: Councils were given £3.2m in March to provide emergency shelter for homeless people, with many housed in hotels. The Government must find alternative funding to keep the homeless off the streets during and beyond COVID-19.
attributes.background: The government will not extend funding to help rough sleepers in England stay off the streets amid the coronavirus pandemic, it has confirmed. This is not what the people of England want and we want out homeless cared and protected

departments.name: Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced additional funding to support moves into the private rented sector, help
individuals to reconnect with friends or family, and extend or procure interim accommodation: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/896650/24-6-20_-_Letter_to_All_LAs_with_annexes.pdf
